candidates.name: Paul Duffy
candidates.why_elect: I have lived,farmed and my wife and I raised our family in this area my whole life. I have been involved in many community organisations and had eighteen years experience as local representative. I understand the commitment required and have the time to do the work.
candidates.why_stand: There is so much about the Waihopai Toetoe Ward that makes it special.The productive farmland, the Catlins coastal area,Waituna Wetlands, our rivers and the people that work hard in our communities. I have been privileged to have represented the area as Councillor and offer myself for a further term.

candidates.name: Julie Keast
candidates.why_elect: I am involved in the community and enjoy hearing individual stories and understanding their issues. I believe that everyone has a contribution to make and together great things happen.
candidates.why_stand: Southland is a very special place that is home for me. I wish to see it protected and enhanced to ensure it is still a great place for future generations—a community that is active and engaged will make this happen.

candidates.name: Amanda Nally
candidates.why_elect: I'm good at asking questions and communicating the answers. Waihopai-Toetoe is a big area with a blend of small town and rural residents—if elected it will be my job to ensure I liaise widely to ensure I'm bringing the views of the wider district to the council table.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running so all Waihopai-Toetoe residents get to vote this election. I'm a self-employed writer and publisher, who enjoys kayaking with baby sea lions. Born in Wanganui, I got here as soon as I could, moving to Southland in 1987 and to Waikawa in 2003.
